photoperiods_PPFD_and_hours.comments: Some research suggests a 6/2 cycle three times a day with 290 PPFD is the most productive possible lighting for leafy greens.

temps.comments: kale is a cool weather crop, but will grow acceptably at room temp

nutrients_EC_and_ppm.comments: kale is rather forgiving in nutrient range

lifecycle.fruit: array with range for when its expected that fruit harvest will begin
lifecycle.end: used for plants whose lifecycles completely end at some point and should be replaced

comments: kale is a cool weather crop. some growers even drop temps as low as 40F to improve flavor
kale can either be grown for early harvest ('baby greens'), or grown for an entire season to continually harvest leaves
